New Records: Nitish Reddy scored 74 runs off 34 balls, including seven sixes and four fours, in his maiden T20 half-century.
India scored 221-9 in their innings, which is the second-highest total against Bangladesh in T20Is after South Africa's 224-4 in 2017.
Nitish Reddy completed a Player of the Match performance with 2 wickets for 23 runs in four overs.
Key Match Events: India recovered from a shaky start (41-3 in 5.3 overs) to 221-9 after Rinku Singh's 53 off 29 and Nitish Reddy's innings.
Bangladesh's top order collapsed to 135-9, with only Mahmudullah top-scoring with 41 off 39 balls.
India's bowlers, including Nitish Reddy and Varun Chakravarthy, took key wickets to restrict Bangladesh.
Pre-Game Insights: India had won the first T20 match by seven wickets in Gwalior, setting up the series win.
Sanju Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Suryakumar Yadav struggled early, but the lower order powered India to a strong total.
Post-Match Reflections: Nitish Reddy expressed pride in his all-round performance and credited the captain and coach for their support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India scored 120 runs in the final 10 overs, highlighting their middle-order dominance with 11 sixes.
Bangladesh's batting lacked momentum, with only five batters reaching double figures.
